Quote:
He talked delightfully to the older ones and played
accompaniments for the younger ones until the last sleepy girl had
followed her mother below. Then he went into the smoking-room. He
played bridge until two o’clock in the morning, and managed to lose a
considerable sum of money without really noticing that he was doing so.

After the break of one fine day the weather was pretty consistently
dull.
Title: Alexander’s Bridge and The Barrel Organ
Author: Willa Cather and Alfred Noyes
